name: clairvoyance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the power to see the future or to see things that other people cannot see: He believed in clairvoyance and magnetic healers. He was struck by a moment of clairvoyance. "You're going to have a great game," he said to his roommate. See
clairvoyant
More examplesFewer examplesShe can’t be blamed for a lack of clairvoyance!The critique released two days earlier seemed like remarkable clairvoyance.Clairvoyance is not among the qualifications listed on the recruitment flier.
